spmap module¶

@author: Juan-David Munoz-Bolanos @main_contributors: Ecehan Cevik and Dr. Tanveer Shaik

spmap.NNLS(M, U)¶

NNLS performs non-negative constrained least squares of each pixel in M using the endmember signatures of U. Non-negative constrained least squares with the abundance nonnegative constraint (ANC). Utilizes the method of Bro.

Parameters

  • M – numpy array 2D data matrix (N x p).

  • U – numpy array 2D matrix of endmembers (q x p).

Returns: numpy array

An abundance maps (N x q).

References

Bro R., de Jong S., Journal of Chemometrics, 1997, 11, 393-401.

spmap.OLS(M, U)¶

NNLS performs linear constrained least squares of each pixel in M using the endmember signatures of U. Non-negative constrained least squares with the abundance nonnegative constraint (ANC). Utilizes the method of Bro.

Parameters

  • M – numpy array 2D data matrix (N x p).

  • U – numpy array 2D matrix of endmembers (q x p).

Returns: numpy array

An abundance maps (N x q).

References

Bro R., de Jong S., Journal of Chemometrics, 1997, 11, 393-401.

spmap.WhittakerSmooth(x, w, lambda_, differences=1)¶

Penalized least squares algorithm for background fitting input

x: input data (i.e. chromatogram of spectrum) w: binary masks (value of the mask is zero if a point belongs to peaks and one otherwise) lambda_: parameter that can be adjusted by user. The larger lambda is, the smoother the resulting background differences: integer indicating the order of the difference of penalties

output

the fitted background vector

spmap.airPLS(x, lambda_, porder=1, itermax=50)¶

Adaptive iteratively reweighted penalized least squares for baseline fitting

input

x: input data (i.e. chromatogram of spectrum) lambda_: parameter that can be adjusted by user. The larger lambda is, the smoother the resulting background, z porder: adaptive iteratively reweighted penalized least squares for baseline fitting

output

the fitted background vector

class spmap.hyper_object(name)¶

abundance(mean, constrain)¶

It calculates the abudance of the mean spectra onto the spectral map

Parameters

  • mean (hyperobject) – hyperobject with the endmembers for abundance calculation.

  • constrain (string) – ‘NNLS’ or ‘OLS’

Returns

abu – concentration of each component.

Return type

hyperobject

add_peaks(prominence, color)¶

After hyper_object.show() it is possible to add peaks

Parameters

  • prominence (float or list of float peaks) – if it is float (how strong the peak finding is or the manual selection of peaks for plotting); if it is a list (it defines the peak positions for plotting manually)

  • color (string color) – color for plotting.

Returns

Return type

None.

gol(window, polynomial, order)¶

Set the value window, polynomial, order

The savitky-golay filter is applied to the full data set

Parameters

  • window (int) – size of number of neighbor pixels to consider.

  • polynomial (int) – order for interpolation.

  • order (int) – order of derivation.

Returns

Return type

None.

hca(distance, linkage, dist, p)¶

Compute hierchical component analysis and plot dendogram.

Parameters

  • distance (string) – type of pairwise distance calculation.

  • linkage (string) – it may be ‘ward’, ‘single’ or ‘complete’.

  • dist (float) – distance for cutting the vertical distances of the dendogram.

  • p (int) – number of brances at the end of the dendogram.

Returns

Return type

None.

Compute pca analysis and print 2 or 3 componets, as well as the loadings up to 10 :param num_components: number of components. :type num_components: int

Returns

  • Print the percentage of coovarience

  • Scores (DataFrame) – array of the components.

  • Loadings (DataFrame) – array of the loadings

Performs pls-lda as long as there are more than 2 classes :param num_components_pls: number of expected components. :type num_components_pls: int :param nor: True aplies normalization otherwise no normalization. :type nor: bool

Returns

show_map(colors, interpolation, unit_in)¶

It plots the label data in the hyperobject

Parameters

  • colors (string list of colors or 'auto') – the colors for the map visualization.

  • interpolation (string) – kind of pixel interpolation: ‘None’, ‘nearest’, ‘bicubic’, ‘gaussian’.

  • unit_in (int) – the plotting scale, 1 = mm and 1000 um.

Returns

colors – DESCRIPTION.

Return type

TYPE

The method shows a 3d scatter plot of the three first components

Parameters

  • label (Panda Series) – Label of the hyperobject for visualization.

  • size (float) – size of the scatter points in the plot.

Returns

Return type

None.

show_spectra(enable, center, colors)¶

Show the labeled spectra in the hyper_object by mean of the labeled objects

Parameters

  • enable (float) – 0: no peaks and larger than 0 adjusts the prominence for finding peaks.

  • center (float) – 0: no baseline, -1: draw baseline at 0 and > 1 creates and offset among the spectra.

  • colors (list of strings or 'auto') – colors for the labeled data.

Returns

Return type

none

show_stack(enable, center, colors)¶

It plots the labeled spectra in a stack shape with standard deviation

Parameters

  • enable (float) – 0: no finding peaks if > 0 activaiton of peak labeling by tuning the prominence.

  • center (float) – 0 draw of center line and other number creates an offset of the labels.

  • colors (list of strings or 'auto') – colors for the spectra visualization.

Returns

Return type

None.

  • size (int) – size of the window (it depends on how wide the spike is).
